title: Richard Madeley asks Louise Redknapp why her marriage ended and viewers can’t get over it
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Richard Madeley didn’t hold back when interviewing Louise Redknapp on This Morning, diving straight into the reasons why her marriage ended with Jamie.

The pair ended their marriage in 2018 after 19 years together, and share sons Charlie and Beau together.

Appearing on This Morning with hosts Richard Madeley and Judy Finnigan to promote her new album, Richard soon switched the subject to her marriage with Partridge-like flair.

Interjecting, Richard said: ‘Can I ask what went wrong or is that delving too deep?’

Richard Madeley didn’t hold back speaking with Louise Redknapp (Picture: ITV)

Louise, in slightly shocked laughs, replied: ‘I wish I knew. It was really sad times. It was really sad and devastating for the whole family and when there is children involved, it’s something that takes a long time to get over.’

Asked about her time on Strictly Come Dancing which was rumoured to have sparked the split initially, Louise said: ‘I think it reminded me, and this was no one else’s fault and definitely not Jamie’s, things that go on in a marriage are far deeper than a TV programme.

‘There’s different emotions and feelings which go on for years. I think what the programme really did for me it just reminded me of how much I really loved performing and music and singing.’

She added: ‘I get asked about it all the time and I never try and shut it down because I think it’s happened and it was very public. But when there’s a whole family involved, it’s massive in everybody’s life.’

Jamie Redknapp and Louise Redknapp (Picture: David M. Benett/Dave Benett/Getty Images)

Speaking about Jamie’s influence on her new album, Louise said: ‘I never went into making the album about that because you don’t, but naturally when you’re writing and you’re in the studio and it’s your safe haven, you naturally pour your heart out. That’s your safe place.

‘So I’d definitely say there’s songs on the album that are never bashing, it’s not about being overly personal, it’s how I felt just as a woman, as a mum, as a wife.’
